org.lasarobotics.vision.android

Class Sensors

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lasarobotics.vision.android.Sensors

  • public final class Sensors
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains methods for reading Android native sensors, other than the camera

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Sensors()
      Instantiate a sensor reader class

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Vector3<java.lang.Float> getAccelerationVector()
      Get the current acceleration vector

      This vector includes the gravity vector; to eliminate gravitational noise, consider the Linear Acceleration vector
      ScreenOrientation getActivityScreenOrientation()
      Get the activity's screen orientation, which can be locked by the activity
      ScreenOrientation getDeviceDefaultOrientation()
      Get the natural orientation of the device.
      Vector3<java.lang.Float> getGeomagneticVector()
      Get the vector pointing toward the current geomagnetic field
      Vector3<java.lang.Float> getGravityVector()
      Get a gravity vector, which points towards the earth
      Vector3<java.lang.Float> getLinearAccelerationVector()
      Get the current linear (gravity-excluded) acceleration vector
      ScreenOrientation getScreenOrientation()
      Get the current actual screen orientation based on sensor data This is independent from the activity screen orientation, which is the current visible orientation.
      double getScreenOrientationCompensation()
      Get the screen orientation compensation, in degrees, between the activity and the target screen orientation
      boolean hasOrientation()
      Test if we have enough sensor data to calculate a screen orientation
      void onAccuracyChanged(Sensor sensor, int i) 
      void onSensorChanged(SensorEvent event)
      Event that fires when sensor data is updated
      void resume()
      Resume reading sensors after reading was stopped
      void stop()
      Pause sensor reading

    • Method Detail

      • resume

        public void resume()
        Resume reading sensors after reading was stopped

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Pause sensor reading

      • getGravityVector

        public Vector3<java.lang.Float> getGravityVector()
        Get a gravity vector, which points towards the earth
        Returns:
        Gravity vector, the sum of which is roughly 9.81 m/s^2

      • getAccelerationVector

        public Vector3<java.lang.Float> getAccelerationVector()
        Get the current acceleration vector

        This vector includes the gravity vector; to eliminate gravitational noise, consider the Linear Acceleration vector

        Returns:
        Acceleration vector, in m/s^2

      • getLinearAccelerationVector

        public Vector3<java.lang.Float> getLinearAccelerationVector()
        Get the current linear (gravity-excluded) acceleration vector
        Returns:
        Linear acceleration in m/s^2

      • getGeomagneticVector

        public Vector3<java.lang.Float> getGeomagneticVector()
        Get the vector pointing toward the current geomagnetic field
        Returns:
        The geomagnetic vector

      • hasOrientation

        public boolean hasOrientation()
        Test if we have enough sensor data to calculate a screen orientation
        Returns:
        True if enough data exists, false otherwise

      • getScreenOrientation

        public ScreenOrientation getScreenOrientation()
        Get the current actual screen orientation based on sensor data This is independent from the activity screen orientation, which is the current visible orientation. Even if the screen is locked, this orientation will be calculated.
        Returns:
        Actual, sensor-based screen orientation

      • getActivityScreenOrientation

        public ScreenOrientation getActivityScreenOrientation()
        Get the activity's screen orientation, which can be locked by the activity
        Returns:
        The activity's screen orietnation

      • getDeviceDefaultOrientation

        public ScreenOrientation getDeviceDefaultOrientation()
        Get the natural orientation of the device. For larger phones it is often LANDSCAPE - for smaller, PORTRAIT.
        Returns:
        LANDSCAPE or PORTRAIT, based on the screen information

      • getScreenOrientationCompensation

        public double getScreenOrientationCompensation()
        Get the screen orientation compensation, in degrees, between the activity and the target screen orientation
        Returns:
        Sensor orientation - Activity orientation + Zero orientation (typically 90 degrees)

      • onSensorChanged

        public void onSensorChanged(SensorEvent event)
        Event that fires when sensor data is updated
        Parameters:
        event - Event data

      • onAccuracyChanged

        public void onAccuracyChanged(Sensor sensor,
                     int i)
